sections.title: Making Your Money Last
sections.subtitle: Strategies for withdrawing from retirement accounts sustainably

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: The 4% rule and other withdrawal strategies

sections.title: Sustainable Withdrawal Strategies
sections.content: The 4% rule suggests withdrawing 4% of your portfolio in year one, then adjusting for inflation. More conservative approaches use 3-3.5% for longer retirements. Dynamic strategies adjust withdrawals based on portfolio performance, reducing spending in down years.

points.title: Fixed Percentage
points.description: Withdraw a fixed percentage annually, adjusting for inflation and portfolio performance.

points.title: Fixed Dollar Amount
points.description: Withdraw the same dollar amount annually, increasing with inflation.

points.title: Dynamic Strategies
points.description: Adjust withdrawals based on market performance and remaining life expectancy.

sections.title: Tax-Efficient Sequencing
sections.content: Withdraw from taxable accounts first, then tax-deferred accounts, then Roth accounts to minimize taxes and maximize after-tax income.

sections.title: Required Minimum Distributions
sections.content: RMDs are mandatory withdrawals from tax-deferred retirement accounts starting at age 73 (for those born after 1950). These are calculated based on your account balance and life expectancy. Failure to take RMDs results in significant penalties.

sections.title: Plan Your Withdrawal Strategy
steps: Calculate your sustainable withdrawal rate based on your portfolio size and life expectancy
Plan the order of account withdrawals for tax efficiency
Set up automatic RMD calculations and withdrawals
Monitor your withdrawal rate annually and adjust as needed

sections.title: Flexibility is Key
sections.content: Life circumstances and market conditions change. Build flexibility into your withdrawal plan and be prepared to adjust spending based on how your investments perform.
